intro: [WRONG START] Gunnioopsis, commonly known as the "spiny dandelion," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and yellow composite flowers. Native to South America, particularly Chile and Argentina, Gunniopsis species are often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plants typically have a low-growing habit with hairy stems and are adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. They play a role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various insects and small animals.
